events.message: The customer reported the car accident that occurred on the highway involving another vehicle during the morning commute.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an auto accident claim involving a collision with another car.
A claims agent was assigned to the case to begin processing the customer's auto accident claim.
The customer was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the claim and informed of the next steps.
The customer was requested to submit the police report, photos of the vehicle damages, and the repair estimate.
The customer provided all required documents including police report, photos, and a detailed estimate from the repair shop.
The investigation into the auto accident claim was initiated to verify the details and assess liability and damages.
The investigation was completed confirming the collision details and validating the submitted damage assessment.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on the estimated repairs and liability confirmed in the investigation.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and readiness to proceed with the claim resolution.
The claim was officially approved after acceptance of the proposed settlement by the customer.
Payment covering the agreed settlement amount was issued to the customer to cover repair costs.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after successful payment and completion of all necessary procedures.
The claim files were archived for record-keeping and future reference as per company policy.
